description:
"

Clock and GPS for Suunto sport model Ambit Peak 3 Black.
A GPS clock with advanced features for outdoor and multisport and mobile connection.

SUUNTO AMBIT3 PEAK: THE ADVENTURE EXPERIENCE
The path to the destination is the most important thing – you speak of the mountains or a personal goal. Suunto Ambit3 GPS clock Peak is ideal for sport and adventure. Will guide you at every step, providing you with all the data needed to progress safely in your business. Connect the watch to your iPhone via bluetooth and using Suunto Movescount App to adjust the clock during the activity and to enrich, relive and share your experience. There isn't a better adventure companion to give importance to your every move.

Main features:

OUTDOOR AND MULTISPORT
-Navigation routes
-Operating time max. 50 h with GPS
-Compass
-Altitude (FusedAltiTM)
-Sunrise/sunset
-Temperature

title: "Cartier Tank Francaise W50002N2" W50002N2 Watch | Watchfinder & Co."
description:
"
                            The Cartier Tank, inspired by an actual tank, has been a design milestone since its inception in the early 20th century. Unlike the modified pocket watches being made by other manufacturers, the Tank used a new case design that actually incorporated the lugs into its shape, rather than adding them as an afterthought. Other iconic design elements include the blued sword hands, Roman numerals, elegant square dial and octagonal crown complete with sapphire cabochon. The Française collection adds a somewhat sportier, more modern feel to an already superb timepiece, making it bolder and more versatile, in large part thanks to its chain-link bracelet—which looks even better in this ravishing all-gold model.
                            
                        ", "This Cartier has undergone a thorough inspection of accuracy, functionality and condition at our Cartier certified service centre to determine the level of reconditioning required to meet our strict standards. It has also been checked against our records to ensure authenticity."

title: "Chopard LUC 161934-5001" 161934-5001 Watch | Watchfinder & Co."
description:
"
                            L.U.C. stands for Louis-Ulysse Chopard, the brand's 19th-century founder, who is remembered for his extraordinary horological talents, creating masterpieces that wowed connoisseurs around the world. So it is no surprise that when the modern company, today run by family Scheufele, was looking to return to making prestigious, in-house movements in the 1990s, it named the resulting collection after its forefather and guiding light, L.U.C. This striking limited edition features a moonphase—a coveted complication under any circumstances, but here enhanced with both mechanical and artistic skill to create a magnificent and incredibly accurate orbital display for both hemispheres.
                            
                        ", "This Chopard has undergone a thorough inspection of water resistance, accuracy, functionality and condition to determine the level of reconditioning required to meet our strict standards. It has also been referenced against technical documents and manufacturer records where available to ensure authenticity and a clean history."

description: "Iconic design, true to the original penned by Max Bill in the 1960's, the Junghans Max Bill Chronoscope is elegant and refined, as well as perfectly simple. Inside the watch is a Junghans self winding automatic mechanical J800.1 movement, with the bare necessities of second, minute and hour, plus date window at 3 o'clock. This is displayed on a matte silver plated dial, beautifully curved, with hour and minutes marked clearly and simply with very slim batons, and luminous markers at the 4 quarters. The case is a stainless steel construction, with curved SICRALAN coated hard plexiglass, true to the original. The watch fastens on a fine milanese mesh steel bracelet with safety clasp."@en

title: "Seiko Men's SKX007K2 Diver's Automatic Watch" "Sport Watches - Page 5 | All Fitness Gadgets"
description: "â— Stainless steel case and bracelet â— Black dial â— Luminous hands and hour markers â— Black unidirectional elapsed time bezel â— Sweep second hand;Scuba diver's â— Water resistant to 200 meters â— Date and day display at 3:00 â— Hardlex crystal; â— Japan automatic movement â— Fold-over clasp with safety A sleek, good-looking watch with water resistance up to 660 feet (200 meters), the Seiko Men's Diver's Automatic Watch is an instant classic. The watch begins with a 40mm stainless steel case and black-toned stainless steel unidirectional bezel. A protected crown graces the right side of the case in a unique 4 'o clock position. title: "Rolex GMT Master II 116710 LN" LN Watch | Watchfinder & Co."
description:
"This Rolex has undergone a thorough inspection of water resistance, accuracy, functionality and condition to determine the level of reconditioning required to meet our strict standards. It has also been referenced against technical documents and manufacturer records where available to ensure authenticity and a clean history.", "
                            The GMT Master was first commissioned in the 1950s by pioneering airline Pan Am, and was designed for aviation. An increase in flight distances created demand for a watch that was able to tell the time in two different parts of the world simultaneously, so Rolex built it with an additional hand that could be set to a second time zone. By the 1980s, the watch had developed into the GMT Master II and was already a favourite among collectors. This model represents a significant upgrade for the watch, boasting an aerospace-grade “superalloy” steel case and cerachrom inserts in the bezel. The LN moniker stands for Lunette Noir—signifying that it uses an all-black bezel.
                            
                        "

title: "Tag Heuer Carrera CAR2A1Z.FT6044" CAR2A1Z.FT6044 Watch | Watchfinder & Co."
description:
"
                            In both name and spirit, the Calibre 01 represents the first of what is expected to become a series of modernised upgrades for TAG Heuer timepieces masterminded by legend of the watchmaking world, Jean-Claude Biver. This model sees the familiar and iconic shape of the Carrera enhanced with an avant-garde (and larger) case build and a striking skeletonised dial. The 45mm titanium-carbide coated case is modular in design, constructed entirely in-house. The same goes for the movement (a modified version of the brand's superb Cal. 1887), which together with the skeletonisation and the red highlights creates a hi-tech aesthetic that builds on the watch's historical race car legacy.
                            
                        ", "This Tag Heuer has undergone a thorough inspection of accuracy, functionality and condition at our Tag Heuer certified service centre to determine the level of reconditioning required to meet our strict standards. It has also been checked against our records to ensure authenticity."

title: "SUUNTO AMBIT 3 PEAK BLACK HR"@en HR - TREKKING GPS Suunto colour Black SS020674000 Athletic footwear apparel and sports equipment"@en
description:
"

Watch, heart rate monitor and GPS for Suunto sport model Ambit Peak 3 Black (HR).
A GPS clock with advanced features for outdoor and multisport heart rate monitoring and mobile connection.

SUUNTO AMBIT3 PEAK: THE ADVENTURE EXPERIENCE
The path to the destination is the most important thing – you speak of the mountains or a personal goal. Suunto Ambit3 GPS clock Peak is ideal for sport and adventure. Will guide you at every step, providing you with all the data needed to progress safely in your business. Connect the watch to your iPhone via bluetooth and using Suunto Movescount App to adjust the clock during the activity and to enrich, relive and share your experience. There isn't a better adventure companion to give importance to your every move.

Main features:

OUTDOOR AND MULTISPORT
-Navigation routes
-Operating time max. 50 h with GPS
-Compass
-Altitude (FusedAltiTM)
-Sunrise/sunset
-Temperature
-Heart rate monitor, swimming (with Suunto Smart Sensor)
-Recovery time depending on the activity
-Speed, pace and distance
-Bike Power Support (Bluetooth Smart)
-More sports in a single registration
-Training Programs
-New functions thanks to Suunto App

CONNECTIVITY
-Upload and share your moves instantaneously (with Suunto Movescount App and Smartphones =
-Customize your watch during physical activity (with Suunto Movescount App and Smartphones)
-Time and GPS satellite data updated during physical activity (with Suunto Movescount App and Smartphones)
-Use your phone as a second display (with Suunto Movescount App and Smartphones)
-See your calls, messages, and transfer notifications on the clock (with Suunto Movescount App and Smartphones)

ENRICH, RELIVE AND SHARE
-Take photos during your performance, showing the current speed, distance and other information (with Suunto Movescount App and Smartphones)
-Create a video on your Suunto performance with 3D map, key values and images (with Suunto Movescount App and Smartphones)
-Share your experience instantly on social networks (with Suunto Movescount App and Smartphones)

THE DEVICES COMPATIBLE WITH SUUNTO MOVESCOUNT APP ARE:
-3° generation iPad and more
-iPad iPad Mini/Air

-5th generation iPod touch

Dimensions:
50x50x18 mm.
Weight 89 gr.

Package contents:
-Suunto Ambit3 Peak Black

-Warranty information

title: "Cartier Tank Francaise W51002Q3" W51002Q3 Watch | Watchfinder & Co."
description:
"This Cartier has undergone a thorough inspection of accuracy, functionality and condition at our Cartier certified service centre to determine the level of reconditioning required to meet our strict standards. It has also been checked against our records to ensure authenticity.", "
                            The Cartier Tank, inspired by an actual tank, has been a design milestone since its inception in the early 20th century. Unlike the modified pocket watches being made by other manufacturers, the Tank used a new case design that actually incorporated the lugs into its shape, rather than adding them as an afterthought. Other iconic design elements include the blued sword hands, Roman numerals, elegant square dial and octagonal crown complete with sapphire cabochon. The Française collection adds a somewhat sportier, more modern feel to an already superb timepiece, making it bolder and more versatile, in large part thanks to its chain-link bracelet.
                            
                        "

title: "Raymond Weil Maestro Beatles Limited Edition Automatic Watch"@en-GB Watch 2237-ST-BEAT2"@en-GB
description:
"MASTERS OF MUSIC

After celebrating its 40th anniversary with The Beatles in 2016, music loving RAYMOND WEIL continues its collaboration with the world’s most famous rock band by releasing a watch paying homage to Abbey Road, the last album recorded by the legendary Fab Four and regarded by some as their most influential composition. This second limited numbered edition of 3,000 watches is a symbol of the timelessness of a group whose success and history are etched in our minds for eternity. 

“I’m a Beatles fan, like probably most other people, but it is true that I have become even more so through meeting the passionate collectors and fans of the band. I have come to grasp the respect and fascination they arouse in people and the impressive heritage that the group left to music. The Beatles have transcended time” said Elie Bernheim, CEO, RAYMOND WEIL. 

Housed in a 39.5mm steel case, the dial of the maestro 'The Beatles “Abbey Road” Limited Edition' is a copy of a vinyl record engraved with microgrooves.  Inspired by the iconic cover depicting The Beatles on the world famous pedestrian crossing, the outlined figures of John Lennon, Paul McCartney, George Harrison and Ringo Starr stride along the groove of their landmark record.

At the heart of the dial and on the sapphire crystal case-back of the watch, the most iconic logo in the music industry beats to the tempo of the mechanical self-winding RW200 movement.

RAYMOND WEIL offers collectors and audiophiles a watchmaking classic with three hands, a date display and the timeless figures of those masters of music forever engraved in time and in the history of music.

Join the discussion on social media networks using #RWTheBeatles."@en-GB

title: "Rolex Milgauss 116400 GV" GV Watch | Watchfinder & Co."
description:
"This Rolex has undergone a thorough inspection of water resistance, accuracy, functionality and condition to determine the level of reconditioning required to meet our strict standards. It has also been referenced against technical documents and manufacturer records where available to ensure authenticity and a clean history.", "
                            Like many of its iconic watch families, Rolex's Milgauss was created in 1956 with a specific market in mind: scientists, power station workers and anyone else exposed to high magnetic fields. It was designed to be able to resist fields up to 1,000 gauss (hence the name—“mille” is Latin for thousand). The watch built a solid reputation with only two models until 1988, and was happily revived two decades later in a modern re-edition that remains faithful to the original purpose and aesthetics—including the beloved lightning bolt hand. This gorgeous GV version (Glace Verte) has a green-tinted dial crystal, and uses a Parachrom-Blu hairspring for even better magnetic and shock resistance.
                            
                        "

title: "Glasgow Silver Damenuhr 36mm"@de "Daniel Wellington Glasgow 36mm nur 139 00 €"@de
description:
"
					Artikel-Nr.: 1640 DW00100047
					
					Elegant-moderne Damenuhr der Marke Daniel Wellington.
					

					Die Oberfläche ist poliert und hat eine silberne IP Beschichtung.
					

					Gehäuse, Zeiger und IndizesIndizes ist das deutsche Wort für das lateinische Index. Spricht man von Indizes, dann sind die Zahlen die die Zeit anzeigen (bei vielen Uhren z.B. arabische Zahlen: 3, 6, 9, 12, aber auch z.B. römische Zahlen: III, VI, IX, XII) oder stattdessen die Platzhalter dafür gemeint. Platzhalter können je nach Gestaltung der Uhr die Unterschiedlichsten Formen haben. Uhrenindexe werden oft nicht nur aufgemalt sondern auch aufgesetzt – bei exklusiven Uhren auch veredelt (mit z.B. Gold, Rosegold, Silber, Chrom). Noch Fragen? Hier geht es zum Uhren-Lexikon sind aus hochwertigen Edelstahl hergestellt und silbern beschichtet.
					

					Auf dem Zifferblatt befindet sich ein Daniel Wellington Schriftzug mit Logo.
					

					Das Mineralglas schützt die Uhr vor äußeren Einflüssen.
					

					Der Gehäusedurchmesser beträgt ca. 36 mm und hat eine Höhe von ca. 6 mm.
					

					Das hochwertige Natotextilarmband gewährt einen angenehmen Tragekomfort.
					

					Das Band wird mit einer DornschließeEine Dornschließe beschreibt die Verschlussart einer Uhr.  In dem längeren Armbandteil werden löcher gestanzt. Auf der anderen Seite befindet sich die Dornschließe, welche aus einem Dorn und einem Metallbügel in U-Form, diese verhindert, dass der Dorn aus dem Loch rutscht.
Dornschließen sind an diversen Materialien zu finden und erstrecken sich in alle Preisklasse. Häufig findet man Dornschließen bei Lederarmbändern oder Textilarmbändern.

 Noch Fragen? Hier geht es zum Uhren-Lexikon, auf welcher zusätzlich das Logo graviert ist, verschlossen.
					

					100 Tage Niedrigpreisgarantie, bei uhrzeit.org kaufen Sie ohne Preisrisiko!
					

					Für unsere Waren bestehen die gesetzlichen Gewährleistungsrechte
						
				"@de

title: "Omega Seamaster Chrono Diver 2599.80.00" 2599.80.00 Watch | Watchfinder & Co."
description:
"
                            The Seamaster is one of the most iconic diving watches of all time. Following from Omega's Marine in 1932, the world's first commercially available diving watch, the legend of the Seamaster officially debuted in 1948. By the time of 1957's 300M, it was among the most dependable and professionally sought dive watches from any brand, and it soon pioneered some of the sporty must-have features we associate with such watches, including unidirectional bezels, phosphorescent hands and the helium escape valve. This excellent model is a closely related sister watch to the version made famous by Pierce Brosnan as James Bond in 1995's GoldenEye—kicking off Bond's attachment to the Seamaster that continues to this day. 
                            
                        ", "This Omega has undergone a thorough inspection of accuracy, functionality and condition at our Omega certified service centre to determine the level of reconditioning required to meet our strict standards. It has also been checked against our records to ensure authenticity."

title: "Seiko Men's SKX007K2 Diver's Automatic Watch" "Sport Watches - Page 5 | All Fitness Gadgets"
description: "â— Stainless steel case and bracelet â— Black dial â— Luminous hands and hour markers â— Black unidirectional elapsed time bezel â— Sweep second hand;Scuba diver's â— Water resistant to 200 meters â— Date and day display at 3:00 â— Hardlex crystal; â— Japan automatic movement â— Fold-over clasp with safety A sleek, good-looking watch with water resistance up to 660 feet (200 meters), the Seiko Men's Diver's Automatic Watch is an instant classic. The watch begins with a 40mm stainless steel case and black-toned stainless steel unidirectional bezel. A protected crown graces the right side of the case in a unique 4 'o clock position. These elements cradle a black dial with prominent luminous hour markers and hands powered by Japanese automatic movement. The dial also features a date display window at the 3 'o clock position. The stainless steel bracelet sports a stylish five-link construction as it reaches out to the fold-over clasp."

title: "Omega Seamaster Chrono Diver 2599.80.00" 2599.80.00 Watch | Watchfinder & Co."
description:
"
                            The Seamaster is one of the most iconic diving watches of all time. Following from Omega's Marine in 1932, the world's first commercially available diving watch, the legend of the Seamaster officially debuted in 1948. By the time of 1957's 300M, it was among the most dependable and professionally sought dive watches from any brand, and it soon pioneered some of the sporty must-have features we associate with such watches, including unidirectional bezels, phosphorescent hands and the helium escape valve. This excellent model is a closely related sister watch to the version made famous by Pierce Brosnan as James Bond in 1995's GoldenEye—kicking off Bond's attachment to the Seamaster that continues to this day. 
                            
                        ", "This Omega has undergone a thorough inspection of accuracy, functionality and condition at our Omega certified service centre to determine the level of reconditioning required to meet our strict standards. It has also been checked against our records to ensure authenticity."

title: "Casio G-Shock GA-100-1A4ER"@en GA-100-1A4ER - Casio Watches"@en
description:
"Casio G-Shock GA-100-1A4ER: shock-resistant, magnetic-resistant, countdown timer, stopwatch, daily alarm, 200-meter water resistance.

Auto-LED light
A light-emitting diode (LED) is used to illuminate the watch face, incl. the feature of an Auto Light Switch that illuminates the display when the watch is angled towards the face.

Shock-resistant
Shock-resistant construction protects against impact and vibration.

Magnetic-resistant
The housing is designed to shield the clock from magnetic fields.

World time function
Displays the current time in major cities and specific areas around the world.

Stopwatch function - 1/1000 sec. - 100 hours
Elapsed time, split time and final time are measured with 1/1000-sec accuracy. The watch can measure times of up to 100 hours.

Timer - 1/1 min. - 24 hours (with automatic repeat)
For fans of precision: the countdown timers help you to remember specific or recurring events by giving off an audible signal at a preset time. They then count back automatically from the preset time. The time can be set to the nearest minute and up to 24 hours in advance. Ideal for people who need to take medicines every day or those who do interval training.

5 daily alarms
The daily alarm reminds you about recurring events with an acoustic signal at the time you have set. This model has 5 independent alarms for flexible reminders of important appointments.

Snooze feature
Each time you stop the alarm, it sounds again after a few minutes.

Speed display
The average speed for a travelled route can be measured. Simply enter the distance at the start and press the stop watch when the destination has been reached - and the average speed is shown.

Automatic calendar
Once set, the automatic calendar always displays the correct date.

12/24-hour timekeeping
Times can be displayed in either a 12-hour or 24-hour format.

Mineral glass
The tough mineral glass resists scratching.

Resin band
Synthetic resin is the ideal material for wrist straps thanks to its extremely durable and flexible properties

2 Years - 1 Battery
The battery supplies the watch with sufficient energy for approx. two years.

Water resistance classification (20 bar)
Perfect for free diving without scuba gear: the watch is water resistant up to 20 bar according to ISO 22810.

Chronometric precision
+/- 15 Seconds per month

Dimensions
55,0 mm x 51,2 mm x 16,9 mm (H x W x D)

Weight
72,0 g
"@en

title: "Rolex GMT Master II 116710 LN" LN Watch | Watchfinder & Co."
description:
"This Rolex has undergone a thorough inspection of water resistance, accuracy, functionality and condition to determine the level of reconditioning required to meet our strict standards. It has also been referenced against technical documents and manufacturer records where available to ensure authenticity and a clean history.", "
                            The GMT Master was first commissioned in the 1950s by pioneering airline Pan Am, and was designed for aviation. An increase in flight distances created demand for a watch that was able to tell the time in two different parts of the world simultaneously, so Rolex built it with an additional hand that could be set to a second time zone. By the 1980s, the watch had developed into the GMT Master II and was already a favourite among collectors. This model represents a significant upgrade for the watch, boasting an aerospace-grade “superalloy” steel case and cerachrom inserts in the bezel. The LN moniker stands for Lunette Noir—signifying that it uses an all-black bezel.
                            
                        "

title: "Omega Seamaster Chrono Diver 2599.80.00" 2599.80.00 Watch | Watchfinder & Co."
description:
"
                            The Seamaster is one of the most iconic diving watches of all time. Following from Omega's Marine in 1932, the world's first commercially available diving watch, the legend of the Seamaster officially debuted in 1948. By the time of 1957's 300M, it was among the most dependable and professionally sought dive watches from any brand, and it soon pioneered some of the sporty must-have features we associate with such watches, including unidirectional bezels, phosphorescent hands and the helium escape valve. This excellent model is a closely related sister watch to the version made famous by Pierce Brosnan as James Bond in 1995's GoldenEye—kicking off Bond's attachment to the Seamaster that continues to this day. 
                            
                        ", "This Omega has undergone a thorough inspection of accuracy, functionality and condition at our Omega certified service centre to determine the level of reconditioning required to meet our strict standards. It has also been checked against our records to ensure authenticity."

title: "Cartier Santos 100 W20073X8" W20073X8 Watch | Watchfinder & Co."
description:
"This Cartier has undergone a thorough inspection of accuracy, functionality and condition at our Cartier certified service centre to determine the level of reconditioning required to meet our strict standards. It has also been checked against our records to ensure authenticity.", "
                            Invented in 1904, the Santos was the first ever men's wristwatch, originally invented for aviation pioneer Alberto Santos-Dumont to make it easier to check the time while flying. The watch was a game-changer in the industry thanks to Santos-Dumont's huge popularity and fame, and to celebrate the origins of the timepiece, Cartier produced a wonderful series of Santos watches called the Santos 100. Modern Santos watches still maintain the classic hallmarks of the original, including the rounded square case, Roman numeral hour markers and fully incorporated lugs. 
                            
                        "

title: "Chronoscope Max Bill"@de 00 €"@de "Junghans Chronoscope Bill 027/4600.00 nur 1.645
description:
"
					Artikel-Nr.: 3531 027/4600.00
					
					Klassischer Chronoscope / ChronographDie Bezeichnung Chronograph leitet sich aus den griechischen Begriffen chronos für „Zeit“ und grapho für „Ich schreibe“ ab und ist die Bezeichnung für eine Stoppuhr.
Erfinder des ersten Chronographen war der Franzose Rieussec im Jahre 1821. Ein Jahr später meldete er auf seine Erfindung ein Patent an. Ein Chronograph verfügt über Stunden- Minuten- und Sekundenzeiger und bietet zusätzlich einen weiteren Mechanismus, der einen meist zentral angeordneten Chronographenzeiger durch manuelle Betätigung eines Drückers aktiviert, deaktiviert und wieder in Nullstellung bringt, ohne das eigentliche Uhrwerk zu beeinflussen. Mit diesem System lassen sich Zeitspannen von einer Minute bis zu 12 Stunden messen, je nach technischer Ausstattung. Noch Fragen? Hier geht es zum Uhren-Lexikon der Serie Max Bill by Junghans
					

					Automatikwerk J880.2
					

					Poliertes Edelstahlgehäuse
					

					Schwarzes Kalbslederband mit DornschließeEine Dornschließe beschreibt die Verschlussart einer Uhr.  In dem längeren Armbandteil werden löcher gestanzt. Auf der anderen Seite befindet sich die Dornschließe, welche aus einem Dorn und einem Metallbügel in U-Form, diese verhindert, dass der Dorn aus dem Loch rutscht.
Dornschließen sind an diversen Materialien zu finden und erstrecken sich in alle Preisklasse. Häufig findet man Dornschließen bei Lederarmbändern oder Textilarmbändern.

 Noch Fragen? Hier geht es zum Uhren-Lexikon
					

					Gewölbtes Plexi-Hartglas
					

					Datumsanzeige
					

					Gehäuse-Durchmesser 40 mm, Höhe 14.4 mm, Gewicht 65 g
					

					Sekungenzeiger
					

					Weißes Zifferblatt
					

					IndizesIndizes ist das deutsche Wort für das lateinische Index. Spricht man von Indizes, dann sind die Zahlen die die Zeit anzeigen (bei vielen Uhren z.B. arabische Zahlen: 3, 6, 9, 12, aber auch z.B. römische Zahlen: III, VI, IX, XII) oder stattdessen die Platzhalter dafür gemeint. Platzhalter können je nach Gestaltung der Uhr die Unterschiedlichsten Formen haben. Uhrenindexe werden oft nicht nur aufgemalt sondern auch aufgesetzt – bei exklusiven Uhren auch veredelt (mit z.B. Gold, Rosegold, Silber, Chrom). Noch Fragen? Hier geht es zum Uhren-Lexikon und Zeiger mit Leuchmasse
					

					Spritzwassergeschützt
					

					100 Tage Niedrigpreisgarantie, bei uhrzeit.org kaufen Sie ohne Preisrisiko!
					

					Für unsere Waren bestehen die gesetzlichen Gewährleistungsrechte
					

					Informationen zu AutomatikuhrenWas sind eigentlich Automatikuhren?Automatikuhren sind Uhren, welche ein mechanisches Uhrwerk aufweisen und von einem Rotor angetrieben werden. Dieser wird  durch Bewegungen vom Arm bzw. Handgelenk  zum Rotieren gebracht  um die Hauptantriebsfeder aufzuziehen.  Aufgrund dessen wird laufend Energie hergestellt, so dass eine Batterie überflüssig wird. Die Gangabweichungen einer Uhr variieren je nach Fertigung, Kalibrierung beim Hersteller, Lebensstil, sowie Tragegewohnheit des Trägers. Die meisten Automatikuhren haben eine Gangabweichung von -20/+30 Sekunden am Tag.  Dies muss leider akzeptiert werden. Sofern eine höhere Ganggenauigkeit gewünscht ist, sind Uhren mit Chronometerprüfung  eine gute Wahl.  Hier erhalten die Uhren das Bewertungszertifikat COSC, für welches sie im Vorfeld diverse Tests bestehen müssen – erst dann dürfen sie sich als Chronometer bezeichnen. Die Ganggenauigkeit darf maximal -4/+6 Sekunden Abweichung am Tag aufweisen und ist ca. 20 Mal genauer als eine normale Automatikuhr. Um der Ganggenauigkeit positiv entgegen zu wirken spielen die Tragegewohnheiten des Trägers eine große Rolle, denn ein aktiver Uhrenträger kann sich über eine genauere Uhr freuen als ein „passiver“ Uhrenträger.Neben der Ganggenauigkeit spielt auch die Gangreserve eine zentrale Rolle bei Automatikuhren. Die Gangreserve, auch Gangautonomie genannt, bezeichnet die Zeitdauer, in der das Uhrwerk weiterläuft, nachdem sie das letzte Mal bewegt wurde. Hier variiert die Stundenanzahl sehr stark und liegt je nach Uhr zwischen 32 und 60 Stunden.Die Langlebigkeit einer Automatikuhr  kann durch das Verhindern von starken Temperaturschwankungen, unnötigen Stößen, Luftdruckschwankungen und Wasserdruck, sowie das häufige Tragen einer Uhr erheblich verbessert werden. Dies wirkt sich auf alle Teile, insbesondere auf das Uhrwerk, sehr positiv aus.Ein großer Vorteil von Automatikuhren ist, dass sie ohne Batterien auskommen. Des Weiteren entfällt das manuelle Aufziehen der Triebfeder. Somit wird eine lange Haltbarkeit einer Automatikuhr gewährleistet. Das Uhrwerk sollte nach 2-5 Jahren ggf. überholt werden, um die Haltbarkeit weiter sicherzustellen.Zu guter Letzt ist es wichtig zu wissen,  wo der Unterschied zwischen Quarz- und Automatikuhren liegt. Quarzuhren sind im Handel in analoger und digitaler Ausführung erhältlich.  Sie sind elektromechanische oder auch vollelektronische Uhren deren Taktgeber ein elektronischer Oszillator ist. Daher ziehen sie ihre Energie meist aus einer Batterie oder aus Knopfzellen. Einige wenige Ausnahmen gibt es, in denen mechanische Energie über einen Mechanismus  in elektrische Ladung umgewandelt und in Akkus gespeichert wird. Dies ist beispielsweise bei der Linie Seiko Kinetic der Fall. Quarzuhren werden meist als Echtzeituhren bezeichnet. Hieraus lässt sich schließen, dass eine Quarzuhr im Gegensatz zu einer Automatikuhr hinsichtlich der Genauigkeit ganz klar die Nase vorn hat und ohne Bewegung der Uhr absolute Genauigkeit aufweist.Automatikuhren sind besonders interessant für Uhrenkenner. Einen Blickfang stellt der flüssig laufende Sekundenzeiger dar. Häufig sind die Uhren mit einem Glasboden versehen, der einen Blick auf das Uhrwerk und den sich bewegenden Rotor zulässt. Die Faszination der Mechanik einer Uhr liegt ganz klar bei Automatikuhr en!
						
				"@de

title: "Rolex Milgauss 116400 GV" GV Watch | Watchfinder & Co."
description:
"This Rolex has undergone a thorough inspection of water resistance, accuracy, functionality and condition to determine the level of reconditioning required to meet our strict standards. It has also been referenced against technical documents and manufacturer records where available to ensure authenticity and a clean history.", "
                            Like many of its iconic watch families, Rolex's Milgauss was created in 1956 with a specific market in mind: scientists, power station workers and anyone else exposed to high magnetic fields. It was designed to be able to resist fields up to 1,000 gauss (hence the name—“mille” is Latin for thousand). The watch built a solid reputation with only two models until 1988, and was happily revived two decades later in a modern re-edition that remains faithful to the original purpose and aesthetics—including the beloved lightning bolt hand. This gorgeous GV version (Glace Verte) has a green-tinted dial crystal, and uses a Parachrom-Blu hairspring for even better magnetic and shock resistance.
                            
                        "

title: "Tag Heuer Carrera CAR2A1Z.FT6044" CAR2A1Z.FT6044 Watch | Watchfinder & Co."
description:
"
                            In both name and spirit, the Calibre 01 represents the first of what is expected to become a series of modernised upgrades for TAG Heuer timepieces masterminded by legend of the watchmaking world, Jean-Claude Biver. This model sees the familiar and iconic shape of the Carrera enhanced with an avant-garde (and larger) case build and a striking skeletonised dial. The 45mm titanium-carbide coated case is modular in design, constructed entirely in-house. The same goes for the movement (a modified version of the brand's superb Cal. 1887), which together with the skeletonisation and the red highlights creates a hi-tech aesthetic that builds on the watch's historical race car legacy.
                            
                        ", "This Tag Heuer has undergone a thorough inspection of accuracy, functionality and condition at our Tag Heuer certified service centre to determine the level of reconditioning required to meet our strict standards. It has also been checked against our records to ensure authenticity."

title: "Cartier Tank Francaise W51002Q3" W51002Q3 Watch | Watchfinder & Co."
description:
"This Cartier has undergone a thorough inspection of accuracy, functionality and condition at our Cartier certified service centre to determine the level of reconditioning required to meet our strict standards. It has also been checked against our records to ensure authenticity.", "
                            The Cartier Tank, inspired by an actual tank, has been a design milestone since its inception in the early 20th century. Unlike the modified pocket watches being made by other manufacturers, the Tank used a new case design that actually incorporated the lugs into its shape, rather than adding them as an afterthought. Other iconic design elements include the blued sword hands, Roman numerals, elegant square dial and octagonal crown complete with sapphire cabochon. The Française collection adds a somewhat sportier, more modern feel to an already superb timepiece, making it bolder and more versatile, in large part thanks to its chain-link bracelet.
                            
                        "

title: "Omega Speedmaster Dark Side of the Moon 311.92.44.51.01.003" 311.92.44.51.01.003 Watch | Watchfinder & Co."
description:
"
                            The Speedmaster is one of the most iconic watches ever made by Omega, if not any brand. The company has done a strong trade in developing the watch's stratospheric reputation as the first and only timepiece worn on the moon during the Apollo missions, but few special edition Speedies are as extraordinary as this one, which takes us to the Dark Side of the Moon itself. The watch is an incredible showcase for high-tech materials: the case, dial and bezel are all made from zirconium oxide ceramics, a lightweight substance that is much harder than steel and very difficult to scratch. Meanwhile, the tachymeter is composed of chromium nitrate, a chemical that gives a pleasingly matte appearance.
                            
                        ", "This Omega has undergone a thorough inspection of accuracy, functionality and condition at our Omega certified service centre to determine the level of reconditioning required to meet our strict standards. It has also been checked against our records to ensure authenticity."

"First built in the 1930s and improved into the 1960s to the watches we see in the collection today, the elegant Meister series of watches bear eloquent witness to Junghans� expertise in mechanical watchmaking, and the highest levels of their design, expertise and craftsmanship.


The Meister Calendar is a celebration of Junghans' expertise. The movement is a delight, an automatic movement featuring day, date, month and moonphase. This wealth of information is displayed elegantly, with no fuss and clutter, on a simple matt silver dial with baton markers and the simple Junghans logo. The movement sits inside a simple, elegant stainless steel case, comfortably sized and curved to sit perfectly on the wrist, and is fastened on a soft, comfortable leather strap.

" Junghans Men's Meister Pilot Automatic Chronograph Watch"@en "Men's Watch (027/3591.00) - WATCH SHOP.com™"@en
description:
"The high demands placed on timekeeping by aviation were first addressed by Junghans in the 1930s, when the company produced on-board clocks for air traffic use.

These were manufactured in level 7 of the now heritage-listed terrace building, the structure offered optimal lighting conditions for the delicate task of watchmaking. The classic instrument appearance of the cockpit was also reflected in the legendary Bundeswehr chronograph of 1955. The design of the Meister Pilot harks back to this: on the bi-directional rotating bezel the 12 distinctive, concave notches ensure a good grip as well as the unmistakable appearance of the timepiece. The screwed case back features a distinctive element: a specially-designed compass rose, which incorporates the symbolism of classic aviation in the form of an artificial horizon. The riveted leather strap ensures a secure fit on the wrist. The particular construction of the front assembly lends the timepiece an unusual elegance for a pilot watch – and the lightness required for take-off."@en

title: "SUUNTO AMBIT 3 PEAK BLACK"@en BLACK - TREKKING GPS Suunto colour Black SS020677000 Athletic footwear apparel and sports equipment"@en
description:
"

Clock and GPS for Suunto sport model Ambit Peak 3 Black.
A GPS clock with advanced features for outdoor and multisport and mobile connection.

SUUNTO AMBIT3 PEAK: THE ADVENTURE EXPERIENCE
The path to the destination is the most important thing – you speak of the mountains or a personal goal. Suunto Ambit3 GPS clock Peak is ideal for sport and adventure. Will guide you at every step, providing you with all the data needed to progress safely in your business. Connect the watch to your iPhone via bluetooth and using Suunto Movescount App to adjust the clock during the activity and to enrich, relive and share your experience. There isn't a better adventure companion to give importance to your every move.

Main features:

OUTDOOR AND MULTISPORT
-Navigation routes
-Operating time max. 50 h with GPS
-Compass
-Altitude (FusedAltiTM)
-Sunrise/sunset
-Temperature

title: " Junghans Men's Meister Pilot Automatic Chronograph Watch"@en "Men's Watch (027/3591.00) - WATCH SHOP.com™"@en
description:
"The high demands placed on timekeeping by aviation were first addressed by Junghans in the 1930s, when the company produced on-board clocks for air traffic use.

These were manufactured in level 7 of the now heritage-listed terrace building, the structure offered optimal lighting conditions for the delicate task of watchmaking. The classic instrument appearance of the cockpit was also reflected in the legendary Bundeswehr chronograph of 1955. The design of the Meister Pilot harks back to this: on the bi-directional rotating bezel the 12 distinctive, concave notches ensure a good grip as well as the unmistakable appearance of the timepiece. The screwed case back features a distinctive element: a specially-designed compass rose, which incorporates the symbolism of classic aviation in the form of an artificial horizon. The riveted leather strap ensures a secure fit on the wrist. The particular construction of the front assembly lends the timepiece an unusual elegance for a pilot watch – and the lightness required for take-off."@en

title: "Rolex GMT Master II 116710 LN" LN Watch | Watchfinder & Co."
description:
"This Rolex has undergone a thorough inspection of water resistance, accuracy, functionality and condition to determine the level of reconditioning required to meet our strict standards. It has also been referenced against technical documents and manufacturer records where available to ensure authenticity and a clean history.", "
                            The GMT Master was first commissioned in the 1950s by pioneering airline Pan Am, and was designed for aviation. An increase in flight distances created demand for a watch that was able to tell the time in two different parts of the world simultaneously, so Rolex built it with an additional hand that could be set to a second time zone. By the 1980s, the watch had developed into the GMT Master II and was already a favourite among collectors. This model represents a significant upgrade for the watch, boasting an aerospace-grade “superalloy” steel case and cerachrom inserts in the bezel. The LN moniker stands for Lunette Noir—signifying that it uses an all-black bezel.
                            
                        "

title: "Seiko Men's SKX007K2 Diver's Automatic Watch" "Sport Watches - Page 5 | All Fitness Gadgets"

The watch begins with a 40mm stainless steel case and black-toned stainless steel unidirectional bezel. A protected crown graces the right side of the case in a unique 4 'o clock position. These elements cradle a black dial with prominent luminous hour markers and hands powered by Japanese automatic movement. The dial also features a date display window at the 3 'o clock position. The stainless steel bracelet sports a stylish five-link construction as it reaches out to the fold-over clasp."

title: "Tag Heuer Carrera CAR2A1Z.FT6044" CAR2A1Z.FT6044 Watch | Watchfinder & Co."
description:
"
                            In both name and spirit, the Calibre 01 represents the first of what is expected to become a series of modernised upgrades for TAG Heuer timepieces masterminded by legend of the watchmaking world, Jean-Claude Biver. This model sees the familiar and iconic shape of the Carrera enhanced with an avant-garde (and larger) case build and a striking skeletonised dial. The 45mm titanium-carbide coated case is modular in design, constructed entirely in-house. The same goes for the movement (a modified version of the brand's superb Cal. 1887), which together with the skeletonisation and the red highlights creates a hi-tech aesthetic that builds on the watch's historical race car legacy.

title: "Tag Heuer Carrera CAR2A1Z.FT6044" CAR2A1Z.FT6044 Watch | Watchfinder & Co."
description:
"
                            In both name and spirit, the Calibre 01 represents the first of what is expected to become a series of modernised upgrades for TAG Heuer timepieces masterminded by legend of the watchmaking world, Jean-Claude Biver. This model sees the familiar and iconic shape of the Carrera enhanced with an avant-garde (and larger) case build and a striking skeletonised dial. The 45mm titanium-carbide coated case is modular in design, constructed entirely in-house. The same goes for the movement (a modified version of the brand's superb Cal. 1887), which together with the skeletonisation and the red highlights creates a hi-tech aesthetic that builds on the watch's historical race car legacy.
                            
                        ", "This Tag Heuer has undergone a thorough inspection of accuracy, functionality and condition at our Tag Heuer certified service centre to determine the level of reconditioning required to meet our strict standards. It has also been checked against our records to ensure authenticity."

title: "Raymond Weil Maestro Beatles Limited Edition Automatic Watch"@en-GB Watch 2237-ST-BEAT2"@en-GB
description:
"MASTERS OF MUSIC

After celebrating its 40th anniversary with The Beatles in 2016, music loving RAYMOND WEIL continues its collaboration with the world’s most famous rock band by releasing a watch paying homage to Abbey Road, the last album recorded by the legendary Fab Four and regarded by some as their most influential composition. This second limited numbered edition of 3,000 watches is a symbol of the timelessness of a group whose success and history are etched in our minds for eternity. 

“I’m a Beatles fan, like probably most other people, but it is true that I have become even more so through meeting the passionate collectors and fans of the band. I have come to grasp the respect and fascination they arouse in people and the impressive heritage that the group left to music. The Beatles have transcended time” said Elie Bernheim, CEO, RAYMOND WEIL. 

Housed in a 39.5mm steel case, the dial of the maestro 'The Beatles “Abbey Road” Limited Edition' is a copy of a vinyl record engraved with microgrooves.  Inspired by the iconic cover depicting The Beatles on the world famous pedestrian crossing, the outlined figures of John Lennon, Paul McCartney, George Harrison and Ringo Starr stride along the groove of their landmark record.

At the heart of the dial and on the sapphire crystal case-back of the watch, the most iconic logo in the music industry beats to the tempo of the mechanical self-winding RW200 movement.

RAYMOND WEIL offers collectors and audiophiles a watchmaking classic with three hands, a date display and the timeless figures of those masters of music forever engraved in time and in the history of music.

Join the discussion on social media networks using #RWTheBeatles."@en-GB

title: "Chopard LUC 161934-5001" 161934-5001 Watch | Watchfinder & Co."
description:
"
                            L.U.C. stands for Louis-Ulysse Chopard, the brand's 19th-century founder, who is remembered for his extraordinary horological talents, creating masterpieces that wowed connoisseurs around the world. So it is no surprise that when the modern company, today run by family Scheufele, was looking to return to making prestigious, in-house movements in the 1990s, it named the resulting collection after its forefather and guiding light, L.U.C. This striking limited edition features a moonphase—a coveted complication under any circumstances, but here enhanced with both mechanical and artistic skill to create a magnificent and incredibly accurate orbital display for both hemispheres.
                            
                        ", "This Chopard has undergone a thorough inspection of water resistance, accuracy, functionality and condition to determine the level of reconditioning required to meet our strict standards. It has also been referenced against technical documents and manufacturer records where available to ensure authenticity and a clean history."

title: "The Time Teller Chrono Black Sunray"@de 00 €"@de "Nixon The Sunray A9722348 nur 189
description:
"
					Artikel-Nr.: 3137 A9722348
					
					Modisch-eleganter ChronographDie Bezeichnung Chronograph leitet sich aus den griechischen Begriffen chronos für „Zeit“ und grapho für „Ich schreibe“ ab und ist die Bezeichnung für eine Stoppuhr.
Erfinder des ersten Chronographen war der Franzose Rieussec im Jahre 1821. Ein Jahr später meldete er auf seine Erfindung ein Patent an. Ein Chronograph verfügt über Stunden- Minuten- und Sekundenzeiger und bietet zusätzlich einen weiteren Mechanismus, der einen meist zentral angeordneten Chronographenzeiger durch manuelle Betätigung eines Drückers aktiviert, deaktiviert und wieder in Nullstellung bringt, ohne das eigentliche Uhrwerk zu beeinflussen. Mit diesem System lassen sich Zeitspannen von einer Minute bis zu 12 Stunden messen, je nach technischer Ausstattung. Noch Fragen? Hier geht es zum Uhren-Lexikon der Marke Nixon
					

					Das Gehäuse ist aus hochwertigem, massivem Edelstahl gefertigt und hat eine gebürstete Oberfläche.
					

					Auf dem schwarzen Zifferblatt befindet sich ein Nixon Schriftzug.
					

					Die Zeiger und IndizesIndizes ist das deutsche Wort für das lateinische Index. Spricht man von Indizes, dann sind die Zahlen die die Zeit anzeigen (bei vielen Uhren z.B. arabische Zahlen: 3, 6, 9, 12, aber auch z.B. römische Zahlen: III, VI, IX, XII) oder stattdessen die Platzhalter dafür gemeint. Platzhalter können je nach Gestaltung der Uhr die Unterschiedlichsten Formen haben. Uhrenindexe werden oft nicht nur aufgemalt sondern auch aufgesetzt – bei exklusiven Uhren auch veredelt (mit z.B. Gold, Rosegold, Silber, Chrom). Noch Fragen? Hier geht es zum Uhren-Lexikon sind ebenfalls aus Edelstahl gefertigt.
					

					Die typischen Chronographenfunktionen, wie das Stoppen der Zeit, sind über die DrückerDas ist der Teil, mit dem sich eine Funktion der Uhr steuern lässt, bei Savonnettes z. B. das Öffnen des Sprungdeckels, bei Chronographen das Starten, Stoppen und Nullstellen, bei Weltzeituhren das Verstellen der Zonenzeiten. Er befindet sich meist neben der Krone am Gehäuserand.  Noch Fragen? Hier geht es zum Uhren-Lexikon am Gehäuserand zu betätigen.
					

					Die Uhr verfügt zudem über eine Datumsanzeige.
					

					Ein Mineralglas schützt die Uhr vor äußeren Einflüssen.
					

					Das Gehäuse hat einen Durchmesser von ca. 37 mm.
					

					Ein Mineralglas schützt das Zifferblatt vor äußeren Einflüssen.
					

					Das 5-gliedrige Edelstahlarmband ist aus gebürsteten Edelstahlelementen gefertigt und gewährt einen angenehmen Tragekomfort.
					

					Verschlossen wird das Band mit einer FaltschließeDie Faltschließe ist eine Verschlussart die am häufigsten bei Metallgliederbändern verwendet wird. Durch häufiges An- und Ausziehen der Uhren kann das Leder an der Dornschließe Risse bekommen, was mit einer Faltschließe verhindert wird. Das Armband wird hierbei nicht vollständig geöffnet, sondern an Scharnieren aufgeklappt und geweitet, sodass man die Uhr problemlos vom Handgelenk bekommt. Noch Fragen? Hier geht es zum Uhren-Lexikon.
					

					Die Uhr kann sowohl von Männern, als auch von Frauen getragen werden und ist ein stylischer Begleiter.
					

					100 Tage Niedrigpreisgarantie, bei uhrzeit.org kaufen Sie ohne Preisrisiko!
					

					Für unsere Waren bestehen die gesetzlichen Gewährleistungsrechte
						
				"@de

title: "Cartier Tank Francaise W50002N2" W50002N2 Watch | Watchfinder & Co."
description:
"
                            The Cartier Tank, inspired by an actual tank, has been a design milestone since its inception in the early 20th century. Unlike the modified pocket watches being made by other manufacturers, the Tank used a new case design that actually incorporated the lugs into its shape, rather than adding them as an afterthought. Other iconic design elements include the blued sword hands, Roman numerals, elegant square dial and octagonal crown complete with sapphire cabochon. The Française collection adds a somewhat sportier, more modern feel to an already superb timepiece, making it bolder and more versatile, in large part thanks to its chain-link bracelet—which looks even better in this ravishing all-gold model.
                            
                        ", "This Cartier has undergone a thorough inspection of accuracy, functionality and condition at our Cartier certified service centre to determine the level of reconditioning required to meet our strict standards. It has also been checked against our records to ensure authenticity."

title: "Rolex Milgauss 116400 GV" GV Watch | Watchfinder & Co."
description:
"This Rolex has undergone a thorough inspection of water resistance, accuracy, functionality and condition to determine the level of reconditioning required to meet our strict standards. It has also been referenced against technical documents and manufacturer records where available to ensure authenticity and a clean history.", "
                            Like many of its iconic watch families, Rolex's Milgauss was created in 1956 with a specific market in mind: scientists, power station workers and anyone else exposed to high magnetic fields. It was designed to be able to resist fields up to 1,000 gauss (hence the name—“mille” is Latin for thousand). The watch built a solid reputation with only two models until 1988, and was happily revived two decades later in a modern re-edition that remains faithful to the original purpose and aesthetics—including the beloved lightning bolt hand. This gorgeous GV version (Glace Verte) has a green-tinted dial crystal, and uses a Parachrom-Blu hairspring for even better magnetic and shock resistance.
                            
                        "

title: "Prospex Diver´s Revival Automatikuhr"@de 00 €"@de "Seiko Prospex Automatikuhr SRP773K1 nur 439
description:
"
					Artikel-Nr.: 1319 SRP773K1
					
					Modisch-elegante Herren-AutomatikuhrDie Automatikuhr ist eine mechanische Armbanduhr, bei der die Feder bei Armbewegungen des Trägers durch einen Rotor in kleinen Schritten aufgezogen wird.
Der Rotor, der zumeist kugelgelagert ist, bleibt bei Bewegungen des Uhrgehäuses aufgrund seiner Massenträgheit und der Schwerkraft im Raum stehen, wobei ein Drehmoment auf den Aufziehmechanismus ausgeübt wird. Im Normalfall wird die Feder in beide Drehrichtungen aufgezogen. Liegt die Drehbewegung des Gehäuses in der Achse des Rotors, so beruht das Prinzip allein auf dem Trägheitsmoment des Rotors. Dieses Phänomen funktioniert also auch in der Schwerelosigkeit. Bei Drehbewegungen, die senkrecht zur Achse des Rotors stattfinden, kommt die Exzentrizität desselben zum Tragen: Der Rotor ist zumeist nur halbkreisförmig ausgebildet, so dass sein Schwerpunkt nicht mit seiner Achse zusammenfällt. Wird die Uhr nur leicht aus der Horizontalen gedreht, genügt dies gegebenenfalls für eine 180-Grad-Drehung des Rotors. Eine Rutschkupplung verhindert ein Überdrehen der Zugfeder, wenn die Uhr bereits voll aufgezogen ist. Automatikuhren zeichnen sich neben ihrer einfachen Handhabung auch durch einen erheblich gleichmäßigeren Lauf aus, der durch die stets gleichmäßig gespannte Feder ausgelöst wird.  Noch Fragen? Hier geht es zum Uhren-Lexikon der Marke Seiko.
					

					Das Gehäuse ist aus hochwertigem Edelstahl gefertigt und hat eine fein gebürstete Oberfläche.
					

					Auf dem dunkelblauen Zifferblatt befindet sich ein "Seiko Automatik Diver´s" Schriftzug.
					

					Die silberfarbenen Zeiger und IndizesIndizes ist das deutsche Wort für das lateinische Index. Spricht man von Indizes, dann sind die Zahlen die die Zeit anzeigen (bei vielen Uhren z.B. arabische Zahlen: 3, 6, 9, 12, aber auch z.B. römische Zahlen: III, VI, IX, XII) oder stattdessen die Platzhalter dafür gemeint. Platzhalter können je nach Gestaltung der Uhr die Unterschiedlichsten Formen haben. Uhrenindexe werden oft nicht nur aufgemalt sondern auch aufgesetzt – bei exklusiven Uhren auch veredelt (mit z.B. Gold, Rosegold, Silber, Chrom). Noch Fragen? Hier geht es zum Uhren-Lexikon sind mit einer Leuchtmasse (LumiBrite) gefüllt, damit auch im Dunkeln die Uhrzeit gut lesbar ist.
					

					Auf der 3-Uhr Position befindet sich eine Datums- und Wochentagsanzeige.
					

					Der Zifferblattrand ist mit einer vollständigen MinuterieAuf dem Zifferblatt umlaufende Einteilung der Minuten, oft zwischen zwei Kreise eingefaßt (‘Eisenbahnminuterie = sieht aus wie Eisenbahnschienen) und teilweise mit ‘5’-Minutenzahlen versehen. Noch Fragen? Hier geht es zum Uhren-Lexikon versehen.
					

					Die Uhr wird durch ein spezielles Hardlexglas vor äußeren Einflüssen geschützt.
					

					Die drehbare, blaue Lünette ist mit einer Minutenskalierung versehen. Die Oberfläche ist mit einer TitankarbidauflageTitan (Ti) ist ein chemisches Element und wird zu den Übergangsmetallen gezählt. Titan zeichnet sich durch besondere Festigkeit ,Korrosions- und temperaturbeständigkeit bei geringem Gewicht aus und ist daher für die Verarbeitung in Uhrengehäusen und -bändern besonders geeignet.
Da Titan in reiner Form praktisch nicht vorkommt, wird es aus Titanverbindungen, z.B. dem Titaneisenerz (Ilmenit) oder dem Titandioxid (Rutil) hergestellt. Da dieser Prozess sehr aufwändig ist, kostet Titan etwa das Zehnfache im Vergleich zu Stahl. Noch Fragen? Hier geht es zum Uhren-Lexikon beschichtet.
					

					Die Uhr wird durch ein Kaliber 4R36 Werk angetrieben. Das Automatikwerk besteht aus 169 Werkteilen und 24 LagersteinenDas Lager einer Uhr sind kleine Bohrungen für die Zapfen des Räderwerks. In manchen Fällen werden die Bohrungen für schnell drehende Triebe und Räder mit Lagersteinen verstärkt. Noch Fragen? Hier geht es zum Uhren-Lexikon.
					

					Die Gangreserve
Als Gangreserve bezeichnet man den Zeitraum, in dem eine Uhr läuft ohne aufgezogen werden zu müssen. Die Gangreserveanzeige beschreibt die verbleibende Zeit bis zum Stillstand einer mechanischen Uhr und gibt so Auskunft, wann eine Uhr erneut aufgezogen werden sollte.
 Noch Fragen? Hier geht es zum Uhren-Lexikon beträgt 41 Stunden.
					

					Die Uhr verfügt über eine beidseitige, automatische HandaufzugmHandaufzug ist die manuelle Form eine Uhr zum Laufen zu bringen. Dabei wird die Aufzugskrone von Hand gespannt und sorgt so für eine Gangreserve von 38-40 Stunden. Noch Fragen? Hier geht es zum Uhren-Lexikonöglichkeit.
					

					Zudem sind der Gehäuseboden und die Krone verschraubt.
					

					Bis zu einem Wasserdruck von 20 bar ist die Uhr wasserdicht.
					

					Das Gehäuse hat einen Durchmesser von ca. 44.3 mm, die Höhe beträgt ca. 13.00 mm.
					

					Das drei-reihige Band ist aus Edelstahl gefertigt und verspricht einen hohen Tragekomfort.
					

					Verschlossen wird das Band mit einer Sicherheitsfaltschließe.
					

					100 Tage Niedrigpreisgarantie, bei uhrzeit.org kaufen Sie ohne Preisrisiko!
					

					Für unsere Waren bestehen die gesetzlichen Gewährleistungsrechte
					

					Informationen zu AutomatikuhrenWas sind eigentlich Automatikuhren?Automatikuhren sind Uhren, welche ein mechanisches Uhrwerk aufweisen und von einem Rotor angetrieben werden. Dieser wird  durch Bewegungen vom Arm bzw. Handgelenk  zum Rotieren gebracht  um die Hauptantriebsfeder aufzuziehen.  Aufgrund dessen wird laufend Energie hergestellt, so dass eine Batterie überflüssig wird. Die Gangabweichungen einer Uhr variieren je nach Fertigung, Kalibrierung beim Hersteller, Lebensstil, sowie Tragegewohnheit des Trägers. Die meisten Automatikuhren haben eine Gangabweichung von -20/+30 Sekunden am Tag.  Dies muss leider akzeptiert werden. Sofern eine höhere Ganggenauigkeit gewünscht ist, sind Uhren mit Chronometerprüfung  eine gute Wahl.  Hier erhalten die Uhren das Bewertungszertifikat COSC, für welches sie im Vorfeld diverse Tests bestehen müssen – erst dann dürfen sie sich als Chronometer bezeichnen. Die Ganggenauigkeit darf maximal -4/+6 Sekunden Abweichung am Tag aufweisen und ist ca. 20 Mal genauer als eine normale Automatikuhr. Um der Ganggenauigkeit positiv entgegen zu wirken spielen die Tragegewohnheiten des Trägers eine große Rolle, denn ein aktiver Uhrenträger kann sich über eine genauere Uhr freuen als ein „passiver“ Uhrenträger.Neben der Ganggenauigkeit spielt auch die Gangreserve eine zentrale Rolle bei Automatikuhren. Die Gangreserve, auch Gangautonomie genannt, bezeichnet die Zeitdauer, in der das Uhrwerk weiterläuft, nachdem sie das letzte Mal bewegt wurde. Hier variiert die Stundenanzahl sehr stark und liegt je nach Uhr zwischen 32 und 60 Stunden.Die Langlebigkeit einer Automatikuhr  kann durch das Verhindern von starken Temperaturschwankungen, unnötigen Stößen, Luftdruckschwankungen und Wasserdruck, sowie das häufige Tragen einer Uhr erheblich verbessert werden. Dies wirkt sich auf alle Teile, insbesondere auf das Uhrwerk, sehr positiv aus.Ein großer Vorteil von Automatikuhren ist, dass sie ohne Batterien auskommen. Des Weiteren entfällt das manuelle Aufziehen der Triebfeder. Somit wird eine lange Haltbarkeit einer Automatikuhr gewährleistet. Das Uhrwerk sollte nach 2-5 Jahren ggf. überholt werden, um die Haltbarkeit weiter sicherzustellen.Zu guter Letzt ist es wichtig zu wissen,  wo der Unterschied zwischen Quarz- und Automatikuhren liegt. Quarzuhren sind im Handel in analoger und digitaler Ausführung erhältlich.  Sie sind elektromechanische oder auch vollelektronische Uhren deren Taktgeber ein elektronischer Oszillator ist. Daher ziehen sie ihre Energie meist aus einer Batterie oder aus Knopfzellen. Einige wenige Ausnahmen gibt es, in denen mechanische Energie über einen Mechanismus  in elektrische Ladung umgewandelt und in Akkus gespeichert wird. Dies ist beispielsweise bei der Linie Seiko Kinetic der Fall. Quarzuhren werden meist als Echtzeituhren bezeichnet. Hieraus lässt sich schließen, dass eine Quarzuhr im Gegensatz zu einer Automatikuhr hinsichtlich der Genauigkeit ganz klar die Nase vorn hat und ohne Bewegung der Uhr absolute Genauigkeit aufweist.Automatikuhren sind besonders interessant für Uhrenkenner. Einen Blickfang stellt der flüssig laufende Sekundenzeiger dar. Häufig sind die Uhren mit einem Glasboden versehen, der einen Blick auf das Uhrwerk und den sich bewegenden Rotor zulässt. Die Faszination der Mechanik einer Uhr liegt ganz klar bei Automatikuhr en!
						
				"@de

"Cartier Santos W20098D6" W20098D6 Watch | Watchfinder & Co."
description:
"
                            It was in 1904 that Louis Cartier gave a watch to his good friend and aviation pioneer Alberto Santos-Dumont that was designed to be worn on the wrist. The Santos watch was the first ever men's wristwatch, originally invented to make it easier to check the time while flying. It was a game-changer in the industry thanks to Santos-Dumont's huge popularity and fame, as well as a very early example of the iconic Art Deco style that would influence fashion and watchmaking for decades. The modern Santos watches maintain the classic hallmarks of the original, including the rounded square case, Roman numerals and fully incorporated lugs. 
                            
                        ", "This Cartier has undergone a thorough inspection of accuracy, functionality and condition at our Cartier certified service centre to determine the level of reconditioning required to meet our strict standards. It has also been checked against our records to ensure authenticity."

World time function
Displays the current time in major cities and specific areas around the world.

Stopwatch function - 1/1000 sec. - 100 hours
Elapsed time, split time and final time are measured with 1/1000-sec accuracy. The watch can measure times of up to 100 hours.

Timer - 1/1 min. - 24 hours (with automatic repeat)
For fans of precision: the countdown timers help you to remember specific or recurring events by giving off an audible signal at a preset time. They then count back automatically from the preset time. The time can be set to the nearest minute and up to 24 hours in advance. Ideal for people who need to take medicines every day or those who do interval training.

5 daily alarms
The daily alarm reminds you about recurring events with an acoustic signal at the time you have set. This model has 5 independent alarms for flexible reminders of important appointments.

Snooze feature
Each time you stop the alarm, it sounds again after a few minutes.

Speed display
The average speed for a travelled route can be measured. Simply enter the distance at the start and press the stop watch when the destination has been reached - and the average speed is shown.

Automatic calendar
Once set, the automatic calendar always displays the correct date.

12/24-hour timekeeping
Times can be displayed in either a 12-hour or 24-hour format.

Mineral glass
The tough mineral glass resists scratching.

Resin band
Synthetic resin is the ideal material for wrist straps thanks to its extremely durable and flexible properties

2 Years - 1 Battery
The battery supplies the watch with sufficient energy for approx. two years.

Water resistance classification (20 bar)
Perfect for free diving without scuba gear: the watch is water resistant up to 20 bar according to ISO 22810.

Chronometric precision
+/- 15 Seconds per month

Dimensions
55,0 mm x 51,2 mm x 16,9 mm (H x W x D)

Weight
72,0 g
"@en

title: "Startimer Pilot Herrenchronograph Big Date"@de "Alpina Startimer Date nur 795 00 €"@de
description:
"
					Artikel-Nr.: 4216 AL-372N4FBS6
					
					Sportlich-eleganter Herrenchronograph der Marke Alpina
					

					Das Gehäuse ist aus hochwertigem, massivem Edelstahl hergestellt. Die Oberfläche ist gebürstet und hat eine schwarze Beschichtung.
					

					Auf dem blauen Zifferblatt befindet sich ein Alpina Schriftzug.
					

					Die Zeiger und IndizesIndizes ist das deutsche Wort für das lateinische Index. Spricht man von Indizes, dann sind die Zahlen die die Zeit anzeigen (bei vielen Uhren z.B. arabische Zahlen: 3, 6, 9, 12, aber auch z.B. römische Zahlen: III, VI, IX, XII) oder stattdessen die Platzhalter dafür gemeint. Platzhalter können je nach Gestaltung der Uhr die Unterschiedlichsten Formen haben. Uhrenindexe werden oft nicht nur aufgemalt sondern auch aufgesetzt – bei exklusiven Uhren auch veredelt (mit z.B. Gold, Rosegold, Silber, Chrom). Noch Fragen? Hier geht es zum Uhren-Lexikon haben eine beige Beschichtung und verleihen der Uhr eine elegantes Aussehen.
					

					Auf der 6-Uhr Position befindet sich eine große Datumsanzeige.
					

					Die Uhr verfügt über eine Stopp-Funktion, die über die DrückerDas ist der Teil, mit dem sich eine Funktion der Uhr steuern lässt, bei Savonnettes z. B. das Öffnen des Sprungdeckels, bei Chronographen das Starten, Stoppen und Nullstellen, bei Weltzeituhren das Verstellen der Zonenzeiten. Er befindet sich meist neben der Krone am Gehäuserand.  Noch Fragen? Hier geht es zum Uhren-Lexikon am Gehäuserand zu betätigen ist.
					

					Eine weiße, vollständige MinuterieAuf dem Zifferblatt umlaufende Einteilung der Minuten, oft zwischen zwei Kreise eingefaßt (‘Eisenbahnminuterie = sieht aus wie Eisenbahnschienen) und teilweise mit ‘5’-Minutenzahlen versehen. Noch Fragen? Hier geht es zum Uhren-Lexikon befindet sich auf dem Zifferblattrand.
					

					Ein SaphirglasSaphirglas (Al2O3) ist von den üblichen Uhrengläsern das härteste. Lediglich der Diamant und einige Karbide weisen eine größere Härte auf und können Kratzer auf einem Saphirglas verursachen. Da Saphirglas relativ stark spiegelt, wird es häufig mit einer Beschichtung versehen (sog. 'Antireflex-Saphir'), die dann leider nicht dieselbe Widerstandsfähigkeit aufweist. Noch Fragen? Hier geht es zum Uhren-Lexikon schützt das Zifferblatt vor äußeren Einflüssen.
					

					Die Uhr wird mit einem äußert präzisem Swiss MadeUm eine Uhr mit dem Qualitätsmerkmal Swiss Made ausstatten zu können, müssen bestimmte Kriterien erfüllt werden. Das Werk der Uhr muss in der Schweiz zusammengesetzt, in Gang gesetzt, reguliert und auch vom Hersteller kontrolliert werden. Außerdem müssen mindestens 50% der vorhandenen Bestandteile aus schweizerischen Fabrikationen bestehen und nach dortigen Standards kontrolliert worden sein Noch Fragen? Hier geht es zum Uhren-Lexikon Quarzwerk, AL-372, angetrieben.
					

					Das Gehäuse hat einen Durchmesser von ca. 44 mm und eine Höhe von ca. 12.40 mm.
					

					Ein hochwertiges Lederarmband gewährt einen angenehmen Tragekomfort.
					

					Das Band wird mit einer DornschließeEine Dornschließe beschreibt die Verschlussart einer Uhr.  In dem längeren Armbandteil werden löcher gestanzt. Auf der anderen Seite befindet sich die Dornschließe, welche aus einem Dorn und einem Metallbügel in U-Form, diese verhindert, dass der Dorn aus dem Loch rutscht.
Dornschließen sind an diversen Materialien zu finden und erstrecken sich in alle Preisklasse. Häufig findet man Dornschließen bei Lederarmbändern oder Textilarmbändern.

 Noch Fragen? Hier geht es zum Uhren-Lexikon verschlossen.
					

					100 Tage Niedrigpreisgarantie, bei uhrzeit.org kaufen Sie ohne Preisrisiko!
					

					Für unsere Waren bestehen die gesetzlichen Gewährleistungsrechte
						
				"@de

title: "Omega Seamaster Chrono Diver 2599.80.00" 2599.80.00 Watch | Watchfinder & Co."
description:
"
                            The Seamaster is one of the most iconic diving watches of all time. Following from Omega's Marine in 1932, the world's first commercially available diving watch, the legend of the Seamaster officially debuted in 1948. By the time of 1957's 300M, it was among the most dependable and professionally sought dive watches from any brand, and it soon pioneered some of the sporty must-have features we associate with such watches, including unidirectional bezels, phosphorescent hands and the helium escape valve. This excellent model is a closely related sister watch to the version made famous by Pierce Brosnan as James Bond in 1995's GoldenEye—kicking off Bond's attachment to the Seamaster that continues to this day. 
                            
                        ", "This Omega has undergone a thorough inspection of accuracy, functionality and condition at our Omega certified service centre to determine the level of reconditioning required to meet our strict standards. It has also been checked against our records to ensure authenticity."

title: "Cartier Santos W20098D6" W20098D6 Watch | Watchfinder & Co."
description:
"
                            It was in 1904 that Louis Cartier gave a watch to his good friend and aviation pioneer Alberto Santos-Dumont that was designed to be worn on the wrist. The Santos watch was the first ever men's wristwatch, originally invented to make it easier to check the time while flying. It was a game-changer in the industry thanks to Santos-Dumont's huge popularity and fame, as well as a very early example of the iconic Art Deco style that would influence fashion and watchmaking for decades. The modern Santos watches maintain the classic hallmarks of the original, including the rounded square case, Roman numerals and fully incorporated lugs. 
                            
                        ", "This Cartier has undergone a thorough inspection of accuracy, functionality and condition at our Cartier certified service centre to determine the level of reconditioning required to meet our strict standards. It has also been checked against our records to ensure authenticity."

title: "Chopard LUC 161934-5001" 161934-5001 Watch | Watchfinder & Co."
description:
"
                            L.U.C. stands for Louis-Ulysse Chopard, the brand's 19th-century founder, who is remembered for his extraordinary horological talents, creating masterpieces that wowed connoisseurs around the world. So it is no surprise that when the modern company, today run by family Scheufele, was looking to return to making prestigious, in-house movements in the 1990s, it named the resulting collection after its forefather and guiding light, L.U.C. This striking limited edition features a moonphase—a coveted complication under any circumstances, but here enhanced with both mechanical and artistic skill to create a magnificent and incredibly accurate orbital display for both hemispheres.
                            
                        ", "This Chopard has undergone a thorough inspection of water resistance, accuracy, functionality and condition to determine the level of reconditioning required to meet our strict standards. It has also been referenced against technical documents and manufacturer records where available to ensure authenticity and a clean history."

title: " Mens Nixon The Crew Watch A1186-001 "Men's Watches | Designer For Men Hut"
"Cartier Tank Francaise W51002Q3" W51002Q3 Watch | Watchfinder & Co."
description:
"This Cartier has undergone a thorough inspection of accuracy, functionality and condition at our Cartier certified service centre to determine the level of reconditioning required to meet our strict standards. It has also been checked against our records to ensure authenticity.", "
                            The Cartier Tank, inspired by an actual tank, has been a design milestone since its inception in the early 20th century. Unlike the modified pocket watches being made by other manufacturers, the Tank used a new case design that actually incorporated the lugs into its shape, rather than adding them as an afterthought. Other iconic design elements include the blued sword hands, Roman numerals, elegant square dial and octagonal crown complete with sapphire cabochon. The Française collection adds a somewhat sportier, more modern feel to an already superb timepiece, making it bolder and more versatile, in large part thanks to its chain-link bracelet.
                            
                        "

title: " Junghans Men's Max Bill Automatic Watch"@en "Men's Watch (027/4002.44) - WATCH SHOP.com™"@en
description: "Iconic design, true to the original penned by Max Bill in the 1960's, the Junghans Max Bill Chronoscope is elegant and refined, as well as perfectly simple. Inside the watch is a Junghans self winding automatic mechanical J800.1 movement, with the bare necessities of second, minute and hour, plus date window at 3 o'clock. This is displayed on a matte silver plated dial, beautifully curved, with hour and minutes marked clearly and simply with very slim batons, and luminous markers at the 4 quarters. The case is a stainless steel construction, with curved SICRALAN coated hard plexiglass, true to the original. The watch fastens on a fine milanese mesh steel bracelet with safety clasp."@en

title: " Junghans Men's Meister Pilot Automatic Chronograph Watch"@en "Men's Watch (027/3591.00) - WATCH SHOP.com™"@en
description:
"The high demands placed on timekeeping by aviation were first addressed by Junghans in the 1930s, when the company produced on-board clocks for air traffic use.

These were manufactured in level 7 of the now heritage-listed terrace building, the structure offered optimal lighting conditions for the delicate task of watchmaking. The classic instrument appearance of the cockpit was also reflected in the legendary Bundeswehr chronograph of 1955. The design of the Meister Pilot harks back to this: on the bi-directional rotating bezel the 12 distinctive, concave notches ensure a good grip as well as the unmistakable appearance of the timepiece. The screwed case back features a distinctive element: a specially-designed compass rose, which incorporates the symbolism of classic aviation in the form of an artificial horizon. The riveted leather strap ensures a secure fit on the wrist. The particular construction of the front assembly lends the timepiece an unusual elegance for a pilot watch – and the lightness required for take-off."@en

title: "Raymond Weil Maestro Beatles Limited Edition Automatic Watch"@en-GB Watch 2237-ST-BEAT2"@en-GB
description:
"MASTERS OF MUSIC

After celebrating its 40th anniversary with The Beatles in 2016, music loving RAYMOND WEIL continues its collaboration with the world’s most famous rock band by releasing a watch paying homage to Abbey Road, the last album recorded by the legendary Fab Four and regarded by some as their most influential composition. This second limited numbered edition of 3,000 watches is a symbol of the timelessness of a group whose success and history are etched in our minds for eternity. 

“I’m a Beatles fan, like probably most other people, but it is true that I have become even more so through meeting the passionate collectors and fans of the band. I have come to grasp the respect and fascination they arouse in people and the impressive heritage that the group left to music. The Beatles have transcended time” said Elie Bernheim, CEO, RAYMOND WEIL. 

Housed in a 39.5mm steel case, the dial of the maestro 'The Beatles “Abbey Road” Limited Edition' is a copy of a vinyl record engraved with microgrooves.  Inspired by the iconic cover depicting The Beatles on the world famous pedestrian crossing, the outlined figures of John Lennon, Paul McCartney, George Harrison and Ringo Starr stride along the groove of their landmark record.

At the heart of the dial and on the sapphire crystal case-back of the watch, the most iconic logo in the music industry beats to the tempo of the mechanical self-winding RW200 movement.

RAYMOND WEIL offers collectors and audiophiles a watchmaking classic with three hands, a date display and the timeless figures of those masters of music forever engraved in time and in the history of music.

Join the discussion on social media networks using #RWTheBeatles."@en-GB

title: "Cartier Tank Francaise W50002N2" W50002N2 Watch | Watchfinder & Co."
description:
"
                            The Cartier Tank, inspired by an actual tank, has been a design milestone since its inception in the early 20th century. Unlike the modified pocket watches being made by other manufacturers, the Tank used a new case design that actually incorporated the lugs into its shape, rather than adding them as an afterthought. Other iconic design elements include the blued sword hands, Roman numerals, elegant square dial and octagonal crown complete with sapphire cabochon. The Française collection adds a somewhat sportier, more modern feel to an already superb timepiece, making it bolder and more versatile, in large part thanks to its chain-link bracelet—which looks even better in this ravishing all-gold model.
                            
                        ", "This Cartier has undergone a thorough inspection of accuracy, functionality and condition at our Cartier certified service centre to determine the level of reconditioning required to meet our strict standards. It has also been checked against our records to ensure authenticity."

description:

An elegant watch will always convey sophistication and style- and this timepiece from Alpina brings you just that. This Gents’ watch can definitely be an awe-striking piece once you lay eyes upon it. description:
"

Clock and GPS for Suunto sport model Ambit Peak 3 Black.
A GPS clock with advanced features for outdoor and multisport and mobile connection.

SUUNTO AMBIT3 PEAK: THE ADVENTURE EXPERIENCE
The path to the destination is the most important thing – you speak of the mountains or a personal goal. Suunto Ambit3 GPS clock Peak is ideal for sport and adventure. Will guide you at every step, providing you with all the data needed to progress safely in your business. Connect the watch to your iPhone via bluetooth and using Suunto Movescount App to adjust the clock during the activity and to enrich, relive and share your experience. There isn't a better adventure companion to give importance to your every move.

Main features:

OUTDOOR AND MULTISPORT
-Navigation routes
-Operating time max. 50 h with GPS
-Compass
-Altitude (FusedAltiTM)
-Sunrise/sunset
-Temperature
-Heart rate monitor, swimming (with Suunto Smart Sensor)
-Recovery time depending on the activity
-Speed, pace and distance
-Bike Power Support (Bluetooth Smart)
-More sports in a single registration
-Training Programs
-New functions thanks to Suunto App

CONNECTIVITY
-Upload and share your moves instantaneously (with Suunto Movescount App and Smartphones =
-Customize your watch during physical activity (with Suunto Movescount App and Smartphones)
-Time and GPS satellite data updated during physical activity (with Suunto Movescount App and Smartphones)
-Use your phone as a second display (with Suunto Movescount App and Smartphones)
-See your calls, messages, and transfer notifications on the clock (with Suunto Movescount App and Smartphones)

ENRICH, RELIVE AND SHARE
-Take photos during your performance, showing the current speed, distance and other information (with Suunto Movescount App and Smartphones)
-Create a video on your Suunto performance with 3D map, key values and images (with Suunto Movescount App and Smartphones)
-Share your experience instantly on social networks (with Suunto Movescount App and Smartphones)

THE DEVICES COMPATIBLE WITH SUUNTO MOVESCOUNT APP ARE:
-3° generation iPad and more
-iPad iPad Mini/Air
-iPhone 4s/iPhone/iPhone 5 5 c/iPhone 5s
-5th generation iPod touch

Dimensions:
50x50x18 mm.
Weight 89 gr.

Package contents:
-Suunto Ambit3 Peak Black
-USB Cable
-Quick Guide
-Warranty information
